thread.title: These male models literally saved a group of kids from drowning in Central Park
thread.title_full: These male models literally saved a group of kids from drowning in Central Park

author: Trilby Beresford
title: These male models literally saved a group of kids from drowning in Central Park
text:
These male models literally saved a group of kids from drowning in Central Park We’ve pretty much come to accept the fact that superheroes aren’t real, and that true heroism comes from regular, everyday people deciding to do the right thing. Oh, and male models. For real.
We just heard that a couple of male models rescued six teens who fell through the ice in Central Park while they were trying to snap a selfie. Here’s how it went down: Bennett Jonas and Ethan Turnbull (AKA: THE MODELS) were skateboarding nearby when they saw the group of teens fall into the ice . They sprung into action and worked together to pull each kid out of the freezing water, including two who sank extremely far beneath the surface.
via GIPHY 
Both guys reflected on this scary — and heroic — experience on social media. “We ran over and immediately we’re put in the toughest situation I think we will have to go through. 6 kids screaming for help being pulled down by each other, soaking backpacks and huge jackets. I had to make a decision to get in the middle of that or watch them drown,” Jonas said in his post.
@ethanturnbull and I tonight went out to Skateboard around Central Park. Passing a frozen lake we saw a group of 6 kids go though the ice. We ran over and immediately we're put in the toughest situation I think We will have to go through. 6 kids screaming for help being pulled down by each other, soaking backpacks and huge jackets. I had to make a decision to get in the middle of that or watch them drown. When I got about waist deep two of the kids jumped on top of me and pulled me under. I had to pick them both up and throw them to Ethan. I then grabbed a ladder and pulled the next 2 in. Behind them were two lifeless bodies that I knew I couldn't get too. I swam out and grabbed the last two guys and was able to get them to shore and keep them alive. I feel humbled and grateful that God called me to be there tonight, I'm still shaking and am completely shook by what I experienced, but I'm alive and so are 6 other kids who got very lucky tonight. 
A post shared by @bennett_jonas on Feb 20, 2017 at 8:39pm PST 
These guys were definitely in the “right place at the right time,” as Turnbull (who is an Aussie FYI) notes in his post. They’re lucky to be alive, and the teens who fell in are extremely lucky to have been saved by people who acted so quickly and calmly. They suffered mild hypothermia, but were given the okay to be released from hospital shortly after.
'Right place right time' - Fortunate enough to have been in the position to help multiple younger generation New Yorker's today. With out the help of my Buddy @bennett_jonas the outcome of this event would have been much different. Thanks to all the friends and family that have checked in NYC #helpingothers #nbc #nbc4ny @nbcnews @dailymail 
A post shared by E T H A N. T. ™ (@ethanturnbull) on Feb 20, 2017 at 8:47pm PST 
Note to selves: Never risk walking on ice! You never know how unstable it really is. NYers, there is no such thing as safe ice. Learn to be #FDNYSmart at https://t.co/zii5uY5RoV pic.twitter.com/FLQ3K5e0Xy 
— FDNY (@FDNY) February 21, 2017 S . Remember how we mentioned that Jonas and Turnbull are male models? No biggie, but they just look like THIS. A post shared by @bennett_jonas on Nov 26, 2016 at 4:21pm PST 
Beach Fit - Australia reincarnation @venroy_sydney @itsnowcool #beach #fit 
A post shared by E T H A N. T. ™ (@ethanturnbull) on Jan 9, 2017 at 4:27am PST 
Good guys to have around, for um, a thousand reasons. But seriously — we’re blown away by their bravery and their willingness to put themselves in danger to help absolute strangers. The world needs more of this, and we’re just so glad everyone ended up being okay!
